page.title: 01SUMMARY OF THE EGGINTON AREA
page.content: Egginton is a small village situated to the S.W. of Derby in the valley of the River Dove. The village lies just off the A38, the old Roman Ryknield Street. It is surrounded by mixed arable and pasture farmland. Many of the farms stand in the village which has recently expanded as new houses fill the vacant spaces. There is a post office and the small primary school is also the village hall. The 13th C church is dedicated to St. Wilfrid. The area is crossed by a railway line and the Trent and Mersey canal. There are several sites for the extraction of sand and gravel. The village of Rolleston on Dove is situated in the S.W. of the block.
